title: Building from source fails on Fedora 33
body:
For bug reports, the following information can help speed up the process. Please describe the bug that you have found and what you would expect to happen instead.

### Expected:

Install dependencies for Fedora and run `cargo build --release` results in no errors.

### Actual
Install dependencies for Fedora and run `cargo build --release` results in:

```
* Installing packages... 
   Compiling libc v0.2.79
   Compiling cfg-if v0.1.10
   Compiling pkg-config v0.3.19
   Compiling proc-macro2 v1.0.24
   Compiling log v0.4.11
   Compiling unicode-xid v0.2.1
   Compiling xml-rs v0.8.3
   Compiling bitflags v1.2.1
   Compiling lazy_static v1.4.0
   Compiling autocfg v1.0.1
   Compiling nix v0.18.0
   Compiling smallvec v1.4.2

   Compiling version_check v0.9.2

   Compiling syn v1.0.46

   Compiling once_cell v1.4.1

   Compiling winit v0.23.0
   Compiling linked-hash-map v0.5.3
   Compiling arc-swap v0.4.7
   Compiling unicode-width v0.1.8
   Compiling serde_json v1.0.59
   Compiling dtoa v0.4.6
   Compiling utf8parse v0.2.0 (https://github.com/alacritty/vte?rev=4f44023dab081f7da74fee14bc53b10ee8f96a1e#4f44023d)
   Compiling fnv v1.0.7
   Compiling percent-encoding v2.1.0
   Compiling regex-syntax v0.6.20

   Compiling x11-dl v2.18.5
   Compiling servo-fontconfig-sys v5.1.0

  process didn't exit successfully: `/home/meneal/Documents/gits/external/alacritty/target/release/build/expat-sys-4c7733d7813e1324/build-script-build` (exit code: 101)
  --- stdout
  cargo:rerun-if-env-changed=EXPAT_NO_PKG_CONFIG

  cargo:rerun-if-env-changed=EXPAT_STATIC

  cargo:rerun-if-env-changed=PKG_CONFIG_PATH
  cargo:rerun-if-env-changed=PKG_CONFIG_LIBDIR_x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
  cargo:rerun-if-env-changed=PKG_CONFIG_LIBDIR_x86_64_unknown_linux_gnu
  cargo:rerun-if-env-changed=HOST_PKG_CONFIG_LIBDIR
  cargo:rerun-if-env-changed=PKG_CONFIG_LIBDIR
  cargo:rerun-if-env-changed=PKG_CONFIG_SYSROOT_DIR_x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
  cargo:rerun-if-env-changed=PKG_CONFIG_SYSROOT_DIR_x86_64_unknown_linux_gnu
  cargo:rerun-if-env-changed=HOST_PKG_CONFIG_SYSROOT_DIR
  cargo:rerun-if-env-changed=PKG_CONFIG_SYSROOT_DIR
  running: "cmake" "/home/meneal/.cargo/registry/src/github.com-1ecc6299db9ec823/expat-sys-2.1.6/expat" "-DBUILD_shared=OFF" "-DBUILD_tools=OFF" "-DBUILD_examples=OFF" "-DBUILD_tests=OFF" "-DCMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX=/home/meneal/Documents/gits/external/alacritty/target/release/build/expat-sys-057eed882b41d6dc/out" "-DCMAKE_C_FLAGS= -ffunction-sections -fdata-sections -fPIC -m64" "-DCMAKE_C_COMPILER=/usr/bin/cc" "-DCMAKE_CXX_FLAGS= -ffunction-sections -fdata-sections -fPIC -m64" "-DCMAKE_CXX_COMPILER=c++" "-DCMAKE_ASM_FLAGS= -ffunction-sections -fdata-sections -fPIC -m64" "-DCMAKE_ASM_COMPILER=/usr/bin/cc" "-DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=RelWithDebInfo"
  -- The C compiler identification is GNU 10.2.1
  -- The CXX compiler identification is unknown
  -- Detecting C compiler ABI info
  -- Detecting C compiler ABI info - done
  -- Check for working C compiler: /usr/bin/cc - skipped
  -- Detecting C compile features
  -- Detecting C compile features - done
  -- Configuring incomplete, errors occurred!
  See also "/home/meneal/Documents/gits/external/alacritty/target/release/build/expat-sys-057eed882b41d6dc/out/build/CMakeFiles/CMakeOutput.log".
  See also "/home/meneal/Documents/gits/external/alacritty/target/release/build/expat-sys-057eed882b41d6dc/out/build/CMakeFiles/CMakeError.log".

  --- stderr
  CMake Error at CMakeLists.txt:4 (project):
    The CMAKE_CXX_COMPILER:

      c++

    is not a full path and was not found in the PATH.

    Tell CMake where to find the compiler by setting either the environment
    variable "CXX" or the CMake cache entry CMAKE_CXX_COMPILER to the full path
    to the compiler, or to the compiler name if it is in the PATH.


  thread 'main' panicked at '
  command did not execute successfully, got: exit code: 1

  build script failed, must exit now', /home/meneal/.cargo/registry/src/github.com-1ecc6299db9ec823/cmake-0.1.44/src/lib.rs:885:5
  note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace
warning: build failed, waiting for other jobs to finish...
error: build failed
```

### Diagnostic

`g++` is not one of the dependencies, but with it installed there are no errors.

### System

OS: Linux (Fedora 33)
Version: building from master branch
Linux/BSD:  Wayland, Gnome

### Logs

Crashes: STDERR, STDOUT
Font/Terminal size: `alacritty -vv`
Keyboard and bindings: `alacritty --print-events`
